conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows an angled cutaway 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible room volumes, multiple wall faces (top/side), and no ceiling/roof to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion, readable wall corners, distinct floor plane, and clean cutaway; minor simplifications in some wall/edge detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (2 bedrooms, living/dining center, kitchen/utility, 2 toilets, 2 decks). Some proportional/positional drift is visible (notably around foyer/circulation and certain partition offsets), and not all openings can be confirmed as perfectly matching the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, living seating, dining set), kitchen counters/appliances represented, and bathroom fixtures visible; a few elements are simplified and exact placement may be slightly idealized.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable with good lighting and minimal artifacts; overall presentation is clean with no UI/text contamination in the 3D render.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion drift relative to the 2D plan (circulation/partition alignment not perfectly preserved in a few areas).
Some door/window placements and sizes are not fully verifiable or appear slightly generalized compared to the 2D plan.
Geometric simplification (e.g., trims/thresholds) slightly reduces strict architectural fidelity but does not break the 3D conversion.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with only minor proportional and opening-placement deviations from the 2D plan.
